title: Republican Cash Edge Threatens to Swamp Democrats in the Midterms
summary: “Donald Trump has 99 problems going into the midterms,” one Democratic strategist said. “But money ain’t one.”

title: Susan Collins Runs for Re-election in Must-Win Senate Seat for Democrats
summary: The Maine Republican is one of her party’s most vulnerable senators, but she has held off Democratic challenges before.

title: Malinowski Concedes to Mejia, a Progressive Activist, in New Jersey Race
summary: Tom Malinowski, who was battered by negative advertising, congratulated Analilia Mejia, a political organizer running for Gov. Mikie Sherrill’s vacant seat in Congress, on a “hard-won victory.”

title: Antonio Delgado Drops Out of NY Governor Race
summary: After falling out with Gov. Kathy Hochul, Lt. Gov. Antonio Delgado mounted a challenge from the left. But his campaign failed to gain traction.

title: Homeland Security Shutdown Nears Amid Stalemate on Immigration Agent Curbs
summary: Republicans have so far spurned most of Democrats’ demands to rein in federal agents carrying out President Trump’s immigration crackdown, threatening a homeland security funding bill ahead of a Friday deadline.

title: Trump Administration Claims About Shootings by Federal Agents Unravel in Court
summary: Before the killings of Renee Good and Alex Pretti, allegations against four others shot at by federal immigration agents failed to withstand scrutiny.

title: Immigration Judge Says Rumeysa Ozturk, a Tufts Student, Cannot Be Deported
summary: The student, Rumeysa Ozturk, who is from Turkey, was detained by immigration agents last year after she co-wrote a pro-Palestinian opinion article for her student newspaper.

title: The Ties That Bound the UK’s ‘Prince of Darkness’ Peter Mandelson to Jeffrey Epstein
summary: For years Peter Mandelson, a senior British politician, concealed the depth of his friendship with the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, until new files were released.

title: Epstein’s Cash and Influence Helped Women Attend Columbia and N.Y.U.
summary: Federal records show that Jeffrey Epstein used donations and connections as he sought to gain college admission for young women in his orbit.

title: Epstein Directed Aide to Obtain Hidden Video Cameras
summary: “I’m installing them into Kleenex boxes now,” the aide replied in the 2014 email exchange.

title: Chappell Roan Leaves Casey Wasserman Agency Over Epstein Files
summary: Casey Wasserman, who founded and leads the talent agency bearing his name, exchanged flirtatious emails with Ghislaine Maxwell in the early 2000s.

title: Ahead of Jobs Report, White House Seeks to Downplay Any Slowdown
summary: President Trump’s top aides have argued in recent days that the economy is strong, even if new data on Wednesday show sluggish hiring.

title: A Campaign to Revoke the Endangerment Finding Appears Near ‘Total Victory’
summary: A small group of conservative activists has worked for 16 years to stop all government efforts to fight climate change. Their efforts seem poised to pay off.

title: Pride Flag Is Removed From Stonewall Monument After Trump Directive
summary: The removal of the flag from the Manhattan monument, the symbolic heart of the gay rights movement, came after a Trump administration memo about flags at national park sites.

title: Trump Threatens to Block Opening of New Bridge to Canada
summary: The Gordie Howe International Bridge, expected to open early this year, was built by Canada to ease cargo transport between Detroit and Windsor, Ontario.

title: A Desperate Father, a Troubled Son and Death in a 5-Star Hotel
summary: Henry McGowan headed for Europe, showing signs of mental distress. His father, John McGowan, raced after him. This week, the son will stand trial in Ireland, accused of his father’s murder.

title: Russia Nears Capture of Key Ukrainian Towns After Year of Grinding Assaults
summary: Russian troops have advanced at a glacial pace in recent months, but gains in southern and eastern Ukraine could give Moscow an edge in U.S.-mediated peace talks.

title: Russia Knocked Out the Heat. So She Slept in a Tent on Her Bed.
summary: With defiant ingenuity, Kyiv residents are trying to find ways to stay warm in a cruel winter.

title: Trump’s Threats to Cuba’s Oil Suppliers Put Mexico in a Bind
summary: The longstanding alliance between Cuba and Mexico is under mounting pressure from the United States, forcing President Claudia Sheinbaum into a precarious balancing act.

title: Air Canada and WestJet Cancel Flights to Cuba Over Jet Fuel Shortage
summary: The Trump administration’s crackdown on oil shipments to Cuba is beginning to wreak havoc on the Caribbean island’s travel industry.

title: Without a Border ‘Invasion,’ Texas G.O.P. Turns to an Old Enemy, Islam
summary: Republican politicians and strategists in Texas are amping up anti-Muslim rhetoric as a way to energize Republican voters after several elections when the border was the animating force.

title: Drinking Is a ‘Social Lubricant.’ That’s Not Always a Good Thing.
summary: Explaining why officials dropped limits, Dr. Mehmet Oz said alcohol “brings people together.” But social drinking also can lead to health problems, studies show.

title: A Shift in Chinese Taste for Durian Throws Malaysian Farmers Into Turmoil
summary: Malaysian durian farmers saw immense profits over the last decade as China snapped up their produce. But tastes have shifted.

title: Watch: A Conversation With Anna Wintour and Her U.S. Vogue Successor, Chloe Malle
summary: In their first joint interview, Ms. Malle spoke about filling the shoes of Ms. Wintour, who urged people to “get over comparisons.”

title: They Use MetroCards to Make Art. They’re Starting to Run Out.
summary: The fare card is dead. How much longer can these New York artists stretch a finite supply?

title: I Just Returned From China. We Are Not Winning.
summary: If we are going to be competitive with China, we have to get our economic house in order.

title: George Saunders on Anger, Ambition and Sin
summary: The acclaimed writer discusses the limits of kindness and the foundations of sin.

title: The End of Arms Control
summary: We look at how world superpowers are approaching nuclear weapons.

title: How Are Health Care Costs Affecting You?
summary: We want to hear from readers who are trying to manage their medical bills and their health insurance costs.

title: How a Decision to Use Whistles as a Prop Cost Eric Adams $4,000
summary: The former New York mayor paid a Conflicts of Interest Board fine for having City Hall employees assist in attacking former Gov. Andrew Cuomo over sexual harassment allegations.

title: How the Israeli President’s Visit to Australia Created a ‘Tinder Box’
summary: Isaac Herzog’s trip led to widespread rallies and tested the restrictions on protests that Australia installed after a deadly attack on a Jewish celebration.

title: The Sublime and Subversive Desire Paths of a Snowy New York
summary: With the snow sticking around, New Yorkers have had to navigate new, temporary terrain.

title: Philippe Gaulier, Clown Who Taught Actors Like Sacha Baron Cohen, Dies at 82
summary: Gaulier often insulted his pupils, but many became stars, including Sacha Baron Cohen, Emma Thompson and Rachel Weisz.
